org.forgerock.openam.http

Class HttpRoute

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.http.HttpRoute

  • public final class HttpRoute
extends Object
    Encapsulates a HTTP route that will handle incoming HTTP requests which can be bound in the Guice injector so it can be registered on the HTTP router.
    Since:
    13.0.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      Creates a new HttpRoute for a route with the given mode and template.

      Creates a new HttpRoute for a route with the given mode and template.

      Creates a new HttpRoute for a route with the given mode and template.

    • Method Detail

      • newHttpRoute

        public static HttpRoute newHttpRoute(org.forgerock.http.routing.RoutingMode mode,
                                     String uriTemplate,
                                     org.forgerock.http.Handler handler)
        Creates a new HttpRoute for a route with the given mode and template. The Handler for this route will be the provided handler class.
        Parameters:
        mode - Indicates how the URI template should be matched against resource names.
        uriTemplate - The URI template which request resource names must match.
        handler - The handler to which matching requests will be routed.
        Returns:
        The HttpRoute.

      • newHttpRoute

        public static HttpRoute newHttpRoute(org.forgerock.http.routing.RoutingMode mode,
                                     String uriTemplate,
                                     Annotation annotation)
        Creates a new HttpRoute for a route with the given mode and template. The Handler for this route will be retrieved from the Guice injector using the base Handler class and the provided annotation.
        Parameters:
        mode - Indicates how the URI template should be matched against resource names.
        uriTemplate - The URI template which request resource names must match.
        annotation - The Guice binding annotation.
        Returns:
        The HttpRoute.

      • newHttpRoute

        public static HttpRoute newHttpRoute(org.forgerock.http.routing.RoutingMode mode,
                                     String uriTemplate,
                                     Class<? extends org.forgerock.http.Handler> handler)
        Creates a new HttpRoute for a route with the given mode and template. The Handler for this route will be retrieved from the Guice injector using the provided handler class.
        Parameters:
        mode - Indicates how the URI template should be matched against resource names.
        uriTemplate - The URI template which request resource names must match.
        handler - The handler to which matching requests will be routed.
        Returns:
        The HttpRoute.

      • newHttpRoute

        public static HttpRoute newHttpRoute(org.forgerock.http.routing.RoutingMode mode,
                                     String uriTemplate,
                                     com.google.inject.Key<? extends org.forgerock.http.Handler> key)
        Creates a new HttpRoute for a route with the given mode and template. The Handler for this route will be retrieved from the Guice injector using the provided handler class and annotation.
        Parameters:
        mode - Indicates how the URI template should be matched against resource names.
        uriTemplate - The URI template which request resource names must match.
        key - The Guice binding Key.
        Returns:
        The HttpRoute.

      • newHttpRoute

        public static HttpRoute newHttpRoute(org.forgerock.http.routing.RoutingMode mode,
                                     String uriTemplate,
                                     javax.inject.Provider<org.forgerock.http.Handler> provider)
        Creates a new HttpRoute for a route with the given mode and template. The Handler for this route will be the provided handler class.
        Parameters:
        mode - Indicates how the URI template should be matched against resource names.
        uriTemplate - The URI template which request resource names must match.
        provider - A Provider that returns the handler to which matching requests will be routed.
        Returns:
        The HttpRoute.
